Uses of Class
piece.GearedObject

  • Packages that use GearedObject 
    Package Description
    piece
    The piece package defines GearedObjects and how they interact.
    piece.track
    The track package defines a handful of files which describe how different track components work and fit together.
    scene
    The scene package consists of classes needed to actually generate spirographs.

    • Uses of GearedObject in piece

      Subclasses of GearedObject in piece 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Rack
      The rack object uses a RackGeometry object and defines the gear count and rotation logic for a rack.
      class  Ring
      A ring object to contain gear and rotation information.
      class  Wheel
      Creates a geared wheel which can rotate along other geared objects
      Methods in piece with parameters of type GearedObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void GearedObject.connectTo(GearedObject peice)
      Creates a linking between the current peice and the parameter.
      float GearedObject.getGearRatio(GearedObject other) 
      void Wheel.rotateStep(GearedObject other)
      Moves the current piece one timestamp forward when simulating spirograph generation.

    • Uses of GearedObject in piece.track

      Subclasses of GearedObject in piece.track 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Track
      The piece.track class defines individual piece.track elements and how they connect.
      class  TrackCap
      This class represents a closing end section of track.
      class  TrackHub
      Defines a track hub consisting of three female ports.
      class  TrackLayout
      This class managed a specific sequence of piece.track segments.

    • Uses of GearedObject in scene

      Methods in scene with parameters of type GearedObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Canvas.draw(Wheel rotationPiece, GearedObject immobilePiece, Pen pen, GeometryPoint penHole, float initialRotation)
      Draws a spiral on the canvas.
